Class HuffmanCoding

  • java.lang.Object
    • HuffmanCoding

  • public class HuffmanCoding
extends java.lang.Object
    This class processes a input file and encodes the input file using Huffman encoding and prints it out. Huffman Coding is an encoding algorithm that uses variable length codes so that the symbols appearing more frequently will be given shorter codes. It was developed by David A. Huffman and published in the 1952 paper "A Method for the Construction of Minimum-Redundancy Codes".
    Author:
    Gabriel Diaz Morro

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method calls all the necessary methods to process the input data. Using the Huffman Coding algorithm.

      • load_data

        public static java.lang.String load_data(java.lang.String inputFile)
        This method receives a file name (including its path) and returns a single string with the string given by the inputFile/parameter.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The path of inputFile.
        Returns:
        line A string with all of the text in the input file.

      • compute_fd

        public static P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> compute_fd(java.lang.String input)
        This method receives the input string and returns a Map with the symbol frequency distribution. A hashtable is used to save time when a symbol appears again, you don't have to look through the whole list.
        Parameters:
        input - A string containing the input text.
        Returns:
        freqResult A map with the frequency of every symbol in the input.

      • huffman_tree

        public static BTNode<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> huffman_tree(P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> map)
        This method receives freqResult and returns the root node of the corresponding Huffman tree.
        Parameters:
        map - A map with the frequency of every symbol in the input.
        Returns:
        root The root of the Huffman Tree.

      • huffman_code

        public static P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> huffman_code(BTNode<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> root)
        This method receives the root of a Huffman tree and returns a mapping of every symbol to its corresponding Huffman code.
        Parameters:
        root - The root node of the Huffman Tree.
        Returns:
        mapped A map with mapping of every symbol to its corresponding huffman code.

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> symbolCodemap,
                                      java.lang.String input)
        This method receives the Huffman code map(which contains every symbol and it's appropriate code) and the input string, and returns the input encoded.
        Parameters:
        symbolCodemap - A map with mapping of every symbol to its corresponding huffman code.
        input - The input string that we got from the input file, that we need to encode.
        Returns:
        result The input string encoded with Huffman code.

      • process_results

        public static void process_results(java.lang.String input,
                                   java.lang.String encodedInput,
                                   P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> fqMap,
                                   P3.DataStructures.Map.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> symbolCodemap)
        This method receives the frequency distribution map, the Huffman code map,the input string, and the output string, and prints the results to the screen (per specifications).
        Parameters:
        input - The input string that we got from the input file.
        encodedInput - The input string encoded with Huffman code.
        fqMap - The map with the frequency of every symbol in the input.
        symbolCodemap - A map with mapping of every symbol to its corresponding huffman code.
